storyTitle: As Employee, I want to update task status to achieve accurate task progress tracking

testCases.title: Validate successful status update with valid input
preconditions: Employee has valid credentials and is authenticated in the system
Employee has at least one task assigned to them
Task management system is accessible and operational
Database connection is active
Predefined status options are configured in the system (e.g., Not Started, In Progress, Completed, On Hold)

steps.action: Navigate to the task management system login page and enter valid employee credentials (username and password), then click Login button
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully authenticated and redirected to the dashboard. The assigned tasks section is visible

steps.action: Navigate to the 'My Tasks' or 'Assigned Tasks' section from the main navigation menu
steps.expectedResult: A list of all tasks assigned to the employee is displayed with current status, task names, and other relevant details

steps.action: Select a specific task from the list by clicking on it to open the task details view
steps.expectedResult: Task details page opens showing task information including current status, description, assignee, and status update option

steps.action: Locate the status dropdown field and click on it to view available status options
steps.expectedResult: Dropdown menu expands showing all predefined valid status options (e.g., Not Started, In Progress, Completed, On Hold)

steps.action: Select a new valid status from the dropdown menu that is different from the current status
steps.expectedResult: The selected status is highlighted in the dropdown and displayed in the status field

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' or 'Update Status' button to save the status change
steps.expectedResult: System processes the request within 2 seconds. A confirmation message is displayed (e.g., 'Task status updated successfully'). The task status is visibly updated in the task details view

steps.action: Verify the updated status is reflected in the task list by navigating back to the 'My Tasks' section
steps.expectedResult: The task shows the newly updated status in the task list view

steps.action: Check that relevant stakeholders receive notification of the status change (if notification system is in scope)
steps.expectedResult: Stakeholders receive notification via configured channels about the status update

postconditions: Task status is updated in the database with the new value
Status update is logged with employee user ID and timestamp in the audit log
Confirmation message is displayed to the employee
Task list reflects the updated status
Stakeholders are notified of the status change

testCases.title: Reject status update with invalid status value
preconditions: Employee is logged into the task management system
Employee has at least one task assigned
System has predefined valid status values configured
API endpoint PUT /api/tasks/{taskId}/status is operational
Validation rules are properly configured in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the assigned tasks list and select a task to update
steps.expectedResult: Task details page opens with status update option available

steps.action: Attempt to submit a status update with an invalid status value (e.g., by manipulating the API request with a value not in the predefined list, or entering invalid data if direct input is possible)
steps.expectedResult: System validates the input and detects the invalid status value

steps.action: Observe the system response after attempting to submit the invalid status
steps.expectedResult: System displays a clear error message (e.g., 'Invalid status value. Please select a valid status from the list') and prevents the status update from being saved to the database

steps.action: Verify that the task status remains unchanged in the database by refreshing the task details page
steps.expectedResult: Task status shows the original value before the invalid update attempt. No changes are persisted

steps.action: Correct the status by selecting a valid option from the predefined status dropdown menu
steps.expectedResult: Valid status option is selected and displayed in the status field

steps.action: Click the 'Submit' or 'Update Status' button with the valid status selection
steps.expectedResult: System accepts the valid status update, processes it successfully, and displays a confirmation message (e.g., 'Task status updated successfully')

steps.action: Verify the task status is now updated with the valid value in both the task details and task list views
steps.expectedResult: Task status reflects the newly updated valid status across all views

postconditions: Invalid status update is rejected and not saved to database
Error message is displayed to the employee
Valid status update is successfully saved after correction
Audit log records the failed attempt and successful update with timestamps
Task status reflects the valid updated value

testCases.title: Prevent unauthorized user from updating task status
preconditions: Task management system is operational with OAuth2 authentication enabled
Role-based authorization is properly configured
At least one task exists in the system
Unauthorized user account exists (user without permission to update the specific task)
API endpoint PUT /api/tasks/{taskId}/status has proper authorization checks

steps.action: Log into the system using credentials of a user who is not authorized to update the specific task (e.g., user from different department, user without task assignment, or user with read-only access)
steps.expectedResult: Unauthorized user is successfully authenticated but has limited permissions based on their role

steps.action: Attempt to navigate to a task that the user is not authorized to update (either through UI navigation or direct URL access)
steps.expectedResult: System checks user authorization for the task

steps.action: Attempt to access the status update functionality for the unauthorized task (either by clicking update button or attempting API call)
steps.expectedResult: System denies access immediately and displays an authorization error message (e.g., 'Access Denied: You are not authorized to update this task status' or '403 Forbidden')

steps.action: Verify that no status update option is available or clickable for the unauthorized user in the UI
steps.expectedResult: Status update controls are either hidden, disabled, or trigger authorization error when accessed

steps.action: Attempt to directly call the API endpoint PUT /api/tasks/{taskId}/status with the unauthorized user's authentication token
steps.expectedResult: API returns 403 Forbidden status code with appropriate error message indicating insufficient permissions

steps.action: Verify in the database that no status change was recorded for the task
steps.expectedResult: Task status remains unchanged. No audit log entry is created for a successful status update. Failed authorization attempt may be logged for security monitoring

steps.action: Log out the unauthorized user and log in with an authorized user (task assignee or user with proper permissions)
steps.expectedResult: Authorized user can successfully access the task and status update functionality is available

postconditions: Unauthorized user is prevented from updating task status
Authorization error message is displayed to unauthorized user
Task status remains unchanged in the database
No unauthorized status update is logged in the audit trail
Security event may be logged for the unauthorized access attempt
Success metric of 0% unauthorized status updates is maintained

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive notifications for task status updates to stay informed

testCases.title: Verify notification sent on task status update
preconditions: Employee is registered in the system with valid email address and in-app notification capability
Employee has notification preferences configured (email and/or in-app enabled)
At least one task is assigned to the employee or employee is a stakeholder on a task
Notification service is operational and integrated with the task management system
Email service is configured and functional
Task status update events are properly configured to trigger notifications

steps.action: Log into the system as an employee who is assigned to or is a stakeholder on a specific task
steps.expectedResult: Employee is successfully logged in and can view their assigned tasks or tasks they are monitoring

steps.action: Navigate to the task details and update the task status by selecting a new status from the dropdown and clicking Submit
steps.expectedResult: Task status is successfully updated and confirmation message is displayed. Status update event is triggered in the system

steps.action: Wait for notification processing (system should send notification within 1 minute as per performance requirements)
steps.expectedResult: Notification service detects the status update event and initiates notification delivery to relevant employees

steps.action: Check the in-app notification center or notification icon in the application interface
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification appears showing the task status update with accurate information including task name, old status, new status, and timestamp

steps.action: Check the employee's registered email inbox for notification email
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received within 1 minute containing accurate task information: task name, task ID, previous status, new status, who made the change, and timestamp

steps.action: Click on the in-app notification to view details
steps.expectedResult: Notification opens and displays complete task status update information. Clicking may redirect to the task details page

steps.action: Verify notification content accuracy by comparing with actual task details in the system
steps.expectedResult: All information in the notification (task name, status change, user who made change, timestamp) matches the actual task data in the system

steps.action: Verify that all relevant employees (assignee, stakeholders, team members) configured to receive notifications have received them via their configured channels
steps.expectedResult: All authorized and configured recipients receive notifications through their preferred channels (email and/or in-app)

postconditions: Notification is successfully sent to all relevant employees within 1 minute
Notification contains accurate task and status information
Notification is delivered via configured channels (email and in-app)
Notification delivery is logged in the system
Success metric of 99% notification delivery is maintained
Employees are informed and can react promptly to status changes

testCases.title: Test notification preference settings
preconditions: Employee is registered and logged into the task management system
Notification preference settings page is accessible to the employee
Notification service supports multiple channels (email, in-app)
At least one task is assigned to or monitored by the employee
Default notification preferences are set in the system

steps.action: Navigate to the user profile or settings section of the application
steps.expectedResult: User profile or settings page is displayed with navigation options

steps.action: Locate and click on 'Notification Preferences' or 'Notification Settings' option
steps.expectedResult: Notification preferences page opens displaying available notification channels and options (email, in-app, frequency settings)

steps.action: Review current notification preference settings and note the default configuration
steps.expectedResult: Current preferences are displayed clearly showing which channels are enabled/disabled (e.g., Email: ON, In-app: ON)

steps.action: Modify notification preferences by disabling email notifications and keeping in-app notifications enabled for task status updates
steps.expectedResult: Preference toggles or checkboxes respond to user input and show the updated selection (Email: OFF, In-app: ON)

steps.action: Click 'Save' or 'Update Preferences' button to save the changes
steps.expectedResult: System displays confirmation message (e.g., 'Notification preferences updated successfully'). Changes are persisted to the database

steps.action: Refresh the notification preferences page or navigate away and return to verify settings are saved
steps.expectedResult: Updated preferences are displayed correctly showing Email: OFF and In-app: ON

steps.action: Trigger a task status update event by updating the status of a task assigned to or monitored by the employee
steps.expectedResult: Task status is successfully updated and status update event is triggered

steps.action: Wait for notification processing period (within 1 minute) and check for in-app notification
steps.expectedResult: In-app notification is received and displayed in the notification center with accurate task status update information

steps.action: Check the employee's email inbox for any email notification
steps.expectedResult: No email notification is received, respecting the disabled email preference setting

steps.action: Update notification preferences again to enable email notifications and disable in-app notifications, then save
steps.expectedResult: Preferences are updated and saved successfully (Email: ON, In-app: OFF)

steps.action: Trigger another task status update event
steps.expectedResult: Task status is updated and notification event is triggered

steps.action: Verify that email notification is received but no in-app notification appears
steps.expectedResult: Email notification is received in inbox with accurate information. No in-app notification is displayed, respecting the updated preferences

postconditions: Notification preferences are successfully saved in the system
System respects employee notification preferences for all subsequent notifications
Notifications are sent only through enabled channels
Disabled notification channels do not receive notifications
Preference changes are immediately effective for new notification events
Employee satisfaction with notification control is improved

testCases.title: Ensure no notifications sent to unauthorized users
preconditions: Task management system is operational with proper authorization controls
Multiple user accounts exist with different roles and permissions
At least one task exists in the system with specific assignees and stakeholders
Unauthorized user account exists (user not assigned to or stakeholder on the task)
Notification service is operational and integrated
Authorization rules are configured to prevent unauthorized notification delivery

steps.action: Identify a task in the system and note its assigned employees and authorized stakeholders
steps.expectedResult: Task details show specific assignees and stakeholders who should receive notifications

steps.action: Identify an unauthorized user who is not assigned to the task and is not listed as a stakeholder or team member
steps.expectedResult: Unauthorized user account is confirmed to have no relationship or permission to access the specific task

steps.action: Log into the system as an authorized user and update the status of the identified task
steps.expectedResult: Task status is successfully updated and status update event is triggered in the system

steps.action: Wait for the notification processing period (within 1 minute) to allow notification service to process and send notifications
steps.expectedResult: Notification service processes the status update event and determines recipient list based on authorization rules

steps.action: Log into the system as the unauthorized user and check the in-app notification center
steps.expectedResult: No notification about the task status update appears in the unauthorized user's notification center

steps.action: Check the unauthorized user's email inbox for any notification emails about the task status update
steps.expectedResult: No email notification is received by the unauthorized user regarding the task status update

steps.action: Verify in the notification service logs that the unauthorized user was not included in the recipient list for the notification
steps.expectedResult: Notification logs show that only authorized users (assignees and stakeholders) were included in the recipient list. Unauthorized user is explicitly excluded

steps.action: Verify that authorized users (assignees and stakeholders) did receive the notification through their configured channels
steps.expectedResult: Authorized users confirm receipt of notifications via email and/or in-app channels as per their preferences

steps.action: Attempt to manipulate notification delivery by trying to subscribe the unauthorized user to task notifications (if such functionality exists)
steps.expectedResult: System prevents unauthorized subscription and displays error message or denies access based on authorization rules

postconditions: No notifications are sent to unauthorized users
Only authorized assignees and stakeholders receive notifications
Authorization rules are properly enforced by the notification service
Notification delivery logs confirm proper authorization checks
Success metric of no unauthorized notifications sent is maintained
Data privacy and security requirements are met

storyTitle: As Employee, I want to receive error messages when task status updates fail to ensure data accuracy

testCases.title: Verify error message displayed on status update failure
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system
Employee has access to task management module
At least one task is available for status update
Test environment is configured to simulate update failures
Network connectivity is available

steps.action: Navigate to the task management page
steps.expectedResult: Task management page loads successfully with list of tasks displayed

steps.action: Select a task from the task list
steps.expectedResult: Task details are displayed with current status visible

steps.action: Click on the status dropdown or status update button
steps.expectedResult: Status options are displayed (e.g., In Progress, Completed, Blocked)

steps.action: Select a new status from the available options
steps.expectedResult: New status is selected and highlighted in the interface

steps.action: Simulate failure during status update (e.g., disconnect network, trigger API error, or use test configuration)
steps.expectedResult: System attempts to process the status update and encounters a failure

steps.action: Observe the system response after the simulated failure
steps.expectedResult: A clear, user-friendly error message is displayed on the screen (e.g., 'Unable to update task status. Please check your connection and try again.' or 'Status update failed. Please contact support if the issue persists.')

steps.action: Verify that the error message does not contain sensitive technical information
steps.expectedResult: Error message is user-friendly without exposing system internals, database details, or security-sensitive information

steps.action: Check the current task status in the system
steps.expectedResult: Task status remains unchanged from the original status (no partial or corrupted update)

postconditions: Task status remains at the original value
Error message is visible to the employee
No data corruption has occurred
System remains in a stable state for retry attempts

testCases.title: Verify error logging on update failure
preconditions: Employee is logged into the system
Employee has access to task management module
At least one task is available for status update
Test environment is configured to simulate update failures
System logging is enabled and accessible
Support team has access to error logs
Log monitoring tools are available

steps.action: Navigate to the task management page
steps.expectedResult: Task management page loads successfully with list of tasks displayed

steps.action: Note the current timestamp before triggering the failure
steps.expectedResult: Timestamp is recorded for log verification purposes

steps.action: Select a task from the task list
steps.expectedResult: Task details are displayed with current status visible

steps.action: Attempt to update the task status to a new value
steps.expectedResult: Status update request is initiated

steps.action: Trigger status update failure (e.g., simulate API error, database connection failure, or network timeout)
steps.expectedResult: System encounters an error during the status update process

steps.action: Access the system error logs or log monitoring dashboard
steps.expectedResult: Error log interface is accessible and displays recent log entries

steps.action: Search for error entries matching the timestamp of the failed update
steps.expectedResult: Error log entry is found corresponding to the failed status update attempt

steps.action: Verify the error log contains essential details including: timestamp, user ID, task ID, attempted status change, error type, and error description
steps.expectedResult: Error log entry contains all required details for troubleshooting: timestamp, employee identifier, task identifier, original status, attempted new status, error code/type, and descriptive error message

steps.action: Verify that the error log includes technical details suitable for support team investigation
steps.expectedResult: Log entry includes technical information such as API response codes, stack traces (if applicable), and system state information

steps.action: Confirm that sensitive information (passwords, tokens) is not exposed in the logs
steps.expectedResult: Error logs contain necessary troubleshooting information without exposing sensitive security credentials

postconditions: Error details are logged in the system
Log entry is accessible to support teams
Task status remains unchanged
System is ready for subsequent troubleshooting or retry attempts
No sensitive information is exposed in logs
